Welcome to How To Cook That I'm Ann Reardon
, we have a fun-packed video for you today.

I'll show you how to make carbonated fruit,
we'll explode some stuff and reveal the name
of the bad guy in the book.

First of all, to make carbonated fizzy fruit
place some chilled fruit in an esky.

And you can experiment with any fruit but
we found smaller ones like grapes worked the
best.

Also carbonating them makes them taste a little
less sweet so use fruit that is super ripe
and at its sweetest.

Add some dry ice all around the fruit, but
make sure it is not touching the fruit or

it will freeze it, and the bigger your esky
is the more dry ice you should use.

When dry ice is heated like when we put it
in warm water here it'll turn straight into

a gas and it skips the liquid stage unless
it's under high pressure.

And that gas it's giving off is carbon dioxide
and that's the same gas that you're breathing

out everytime you breathe out all day long
and it's also what the bubbles in fizzy drinks
are made of.

Put the lid on the esky and wrap the whole
thing tightly in lots of layers of plastic
wrap.

And this will just slow down the escape of
the gasses.

But you do not want to use an airtight container
for this because if you do when the dry ice

turns into gas it will be completely trapped
in the container and eventually ...
Let's do that again...

Seriously though do not do this at home because
you can get nasty injuries from flying debris.

I'll link you to a Reardon Bros video at the
end of this one with 10 other safe dry ice
experiments that you can do.

Now after about 12 hours, take off that plastic
wrap and remove the lid.

And the dry ice is gone because it's turned
into a gas and the fruit looks the same.
But when you eat it...
